definition: variant of 耽誤|耽误[dan1 wu5]
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
mistake/error/to miss/to harm/to delay/to neglect/mistakenly

sentences.english: In order to avoid your valuable time, please choose other contact information.
sentences.chinese: 为免担误您的宝贵时间，请选择其它联系方式。

sentences.english: You're dead meat if you cool my heels like that again.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再这样担误我的时间，你就死定了。

sentences.english: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting. We were a little late in getting underway.
sentences.chinese: 真抱歉，让你久等，我们出发时担误了一会儿。

sentences.english: It won't be too long , sir.
sentences.chinese: 不会担误您太长的时间，先生。

sentences.english: Invite you the essential factor does not look for valuables but mistake time loses picul consequently fleeing for one's life chance.
sentences.chinese: 请您不要因寻贵重物品而担误时间以致失去逃生机会。

definition: variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]
to tarry/to delay/to stop over
to make a journey for nothing
to delay/to procrastinate
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
to hold things up/to make a botch of things
to worry/to be on one's mind
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to procrastinate
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
variant of 擔心|担心[dan1 xin1]
worried/anxious
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
to accompany over long term
urgent
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
